content:
See if anything relevant shows up in the Error Console:

- press Ctrl-Shift-j

- click the Trash can on the upper left to clear the console

- make sure 'Errors' is the only category selected

- start the rebuild

- if there are errors, R. click > Copy Message or Copy all Messages > paste here
creator: siffemoz

content: There seems to be a corrupt folder (= a corrupt mbox file) in your profile. Repair all your folders before starting the next rebuilding the GLODA. .... or at least the folder where it gets stuck when the indexing stops.

content:
Account Hub is experimental and only gets used when you have at least one account already created in Thunderbird.

Both Account Hub and Account Setup can be used for imap and pop accounts.
creator: wsmwk

content:
I see now there are confusingly two different user interfaces to ad accounts to thunderbird. I cannot say that this is reassuring for new and old users. Certainly with something so critical as setting up accounts.

and yes, asked a similar question as these two user interfaces are different.

This confusing "feature" can be shut off in settings (click top left hamburger)
creator: theking2

content:
I presume these accounts are on the same version of thunderbird. My first suggestion is this - click to her email account pane - on bottom line is 'Outgoing Server; - click the button 'edit outgoing server' - does this pane show her email address or yours? If it shows yours, then her setting is not being used. DO NOT change this, as her account may be pointing to yours, and changing might reverse the problem. instead,

- click to account settings pane - at bottom of left side bar is link to outgoing servers pane. click it - there, you should see an SMTP server setting for her account. Edit the DESCRIPTION field to have her name - then, return to her account pane and on the bottom line, click the drop-down menu and select the SMTP server that you just renamed.
creator: davidsk

content: click settings>general and UNTICK to box for the experimental setup wizard and restart your attempt. see attached.
